page.title: 15 TRANSPORT
page.content: The most popular form of transport in this area is easily the car,as Rainford is a high car-owning area.Bikes are popular among the young and old,but mainly as a pastime.There are also two taxi services operating from Rainford. Public transport is usually buses: there are nine different routes going through Rainford village.This adds up to about 78 buses per day.Passing through Crank there are 13 buses a day, with 5 going to King's Moss.Going along the Rainford By-Pass(A570) there are eight bus routes used every day.All of the buses going through Rainford go to/through St.Helens,except for one. The bus services are well-used,espec- ially at weekends,by people going to St.Helens,Southport etc..In rural areas the bus services are,for many,the only link with the towns.
